title: Building Name Carved in Stone, late 1950's
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725073404im_/http:/typophile.com/files/University1_3573.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725073404im_/http:/typophile.com/files/University2_6421.jpg)

I thought this might be a gothic font, but my searches haven't turned anything up.
author: donaquixote

comments.content:
It appears to be a hand-drawn uncial font (derived from medieval manuscript hand lettering).

A search on myfonts.com using "uncial" as a descriptive turned up dozens of fonts, but no exact match. However, several came closer than others.

Yes, closer than others: Aneirin  
 [www.dafont.com/search.php?q=Aneirin&text=UNIVERSITY HALL](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725073404/http:/typophile.com/wiki/www.dafont.com/search.php%3Fq%3DAneirin%2526text%3DUNIVERSITY%20HALL)  
or  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/aneirin/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725073404/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/aneirin/)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725073404im_/http:/typophile.com/files/univ1_5488.jpg)

The lower case of Bergling

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725073404im_/http:/typophile.com/files/InitialsBerglingAInUse2_6187.jpg)
 would work nicely as a quality substitute. [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/alterlittera/initials-bergling-a/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725073404/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alterlittera/initials-bergling-a/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/alterlittera/initials-bergling-a/")  
Don

To make a matching \_u\_ in Bergling, simply mirror and flip the \_n\_. I suspect the stone lettering is based on Bergling's book \_Art Alphabets and Lettering\_, the same source as used for the Bergling Initials font.  
Don

Just curious, where is the building?  
Don
